intro: Benthamia africana, commonly known as the African benthamia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid to semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water. The flowers, which are small and yellowish, bloom in spring and attract various pollinators.
